message_1: Consider a beauty contest game where there are 10 players who need to select a number between 0 and 100. The winner will be the person whose number is the closest to 2/3 of the average of all the selected numbers. If two or more players select the same closest number, they will share the prize equally. What number should you select to have the best chance of winning the game?
message_2:

This is because the winning number is determined by the average of all the selected numbers, and you want to be as close as possible to 2/3 of that average.

Let's assume that the other players are also rational and will choose numbers based on the same logic. If all players think that the others will choose numbers uniformly distributed between 0 and 100, the average of their guesses would be 50. In this case, you should choose 2/3 * 50 = 33.33.

However, if all players think like this, the actual average of the guesses will be lower than 50, since everyone is choosing a number around 33.33. So, you should adjust your guess accordingly.
